channel.title: Black Mesa Public Beta Patch- Jan 13th 2016
channel.description:
Hey everybody!
This isn't actually a new patch, it's been out for a little while now. I'm comfortable with what we have now though to kind of publically say "we have issues fixed and we need help checking!" A reminder though is that this is a BETA patch. Which means that the fixes are intended to work, but may not work as intended. (buggy bug fixes!).
If you're interested in trying things out, or if there is a fix for something that you're interested in, you can opt-into the public beta *right now!* (if you own the steam version of the game). To participate: right click on in your steam browser, click "Properties." Go to the Beta Tab. Select "Public Beta." You're now in the Public Beta! If you no longer want to be part of the public beta branch, you can go back to the Beta's tab under properties, and set your beta to "none - Opt out of all betas." When you opt in, you'll see a download happening, that's perfectly normal.
As of Jan 13th, 2016 the Public Beta changes from the Crossfire Update are as followed:
* Added muzzle flash dynamic light checkbox to options menu. * Added godrays enable checkbox to the options menu * Minor optimizations made to netcode. * Crossfire performance optimizations. * Fixed 'FIX IT DENIZ' skin on monitor in UC. * Polished the workshop tool. (like, it works now, and you can upload thumbnails).* [list][*]ingame UI for the "workshop addons'" button in the menu is a much larger bug, so it has not been fixed. the rest of the uploader is working better now. [/*:m][/list:u]
*The workshop tool now places mods in the SteamApps/Workshop/Content/362890 folder. When you subscribe to a mod, it will add a folder with the mods ID, to that folder. The uploader will recognize .vpk mods and non-.vpk mods. It is preferred and considered good practice if you make a .vpk mod. (I will provide instructions on how to do that, later). I will be creating a full 'how to upload a mod' guide here soon.
There may be more things that are fixed that I have missed.
Please keep this thread to JUST the public beta fixes. This is not the place to discuss what needs to be fixed, or bugs that haven't been fixed yet and/or 'why haven't you fixed XYZ bug?' discussions. If I see that the discussion is moving off-topic, I will move or remove posts as necessary. Thanks!
Known issue: Loading times for Black Mesa for launching the first time during a computer session is longer than it should be.

item.title: Black Mesa Public Beta Patch- Jan 13th 2016
item.dc:creator: Fr0z3n
item.description:
KyuuGryphon:

In Half-Life 2 speedrunning, that bug’s referred to as Schrodinger’s Crouching, if I recall. If you start holding crouch again in the middle of standing up from a crouch, the player hitbox is still crouching, while the camera gets disconnected at the height you were at when you started crouching again. I don’t know if I’m explaining it very well.

It allows the player to push buttons through walls or ceilings, though I can’t really think of anywhere in Black Mesa that can be exploited that way. Arguably, the more severe effects are 1. the player can see through brushes outside of the map (e.g. getting the camera stuck in the top of a vent) and 2. the disconnect between the player hitbox and camera causes the NPCs’ aiming to get thrown off.

Interesting… That makes sense. Thanks!

item.dc:creator: KyuuGryphon
item.description:
Late reply, but I’m talking about addons working on the public beta, though. I’ve resubscribed to all of them, but the content just doesn’t load in-game.

Off the top of my head, what I’ve tried:

  • Copying the .vpk’s from /addons/workshop into the addons folder and deleting all other instances of the addons - vanilla content is used in-game
  • Resubscribing to every single addon - get missing content errors in-game
  • Copying the .vpk’s from /addons/workshop into the /steamapps/workshop/content/362890 folder - get missing content errors in-game
  • Copying the .vpk’s from /addons/workshop into the corresponding subfolder in /steamapps/workshop/content/362890 (the one addon that did work on the public beta - Crypt’s HD-style arms - had a .vpk file in there) - get missing content errors in-game
  • Deleting everything in the /steamapps/workshop/content/362890 folder, as well as deleting the entire /addons folder, and resubscribing to an addon - get missing content errors in-game
    Is this a bug, or am I just an idiot?

item.title: Black Mesa Public Beta Patch- Jan 13th 2016
item.dc:creator: KyuuGryphon
item.description:
Fr0z3n:
KyuuGryphon:

Tried copying all the .vpk’s from addons over to the new folder, things still aren’t working right.

The game either uses vanilla content instead of the addon, or (more commonly) fails to load the content altogether (i.e. missing materials, models, sounds, etc.).

Was there a change to the file structure that would cause old .vpk’s to behave this way?

You need to resubscribe to all the workshop content, as it needs a specific folder with the workshop item ID. When you sub, it’ll make a folder in the content/362890 folder with a unique number and the content inside that. Can’t just drop the .vpk’s into the addons folder.

Went ahead and resubscribed to all of my workshop addons - a vast majority of them are still not working.
